access_limitations.name: access_limitations
access_limitations.description: Data access limitations as defined in the GA4GH Data Use Ontology (DUO)

meta.notes: Refer to the Data Use Ontology code https://github.com/EBISPOT/DUO and provide a semicolon (;) delimited list of requirements

access_requirements.name: access_requirements
access_requirements.description: Data use requirements as defined in the GA4GH Data Use Ontology (DUO)

meta.notes: Refer to the Data Use Ontology code https://github.com/EBISPOT/DUO and provide a semicolon (;) delimited list of requirements
meta.examples: Ethics approval required (DUO:0000021); Time limit on use (DUO:0000025)

access_authority.name: access_authority
access_authority.description: Contact information for the Stuy's access authority

entity_type.name: entity_type
entity_type.description: Type of entity to which access limitations and requirements apply

access_limitations.name: access_limitations
access_limitations.description: Data access limitations as defined in the GA4GH Data Use Ontology (DUO)

meta.notes: Refer to the Data Use Ontology code https://github.com/EBISPOT/DUO

access_requirements.name: access_requirements
access_requirements.description: Data use requirements as defined in the GA4GH Data Use Ontology (DUO)

meta.notes: Refer to the Data Use Ontology code https://github.com/EBISPOT/DUO

notes.left: French Canadian trace their ancestry to French colonists who settled in Canada, English Canadians are of English ethnic origin and heritage, Aboriginal (First Nations, Metis, Inuit), White (European descent), Arab (e.g. Egypt, Iraq, Jordan, Lebanon), Latin American (Hispanic), Black (African/Caribbean), East Asian (e.g. China, Japan, Korea, Taiwan), West Asian (e.g. Turkey, Iran, Afghanistan), Southeast Asian (e.g. Malaysia, Indonesia, Viet Nam), South Asian (e.g. India, Sri Lanka, Pakistan, Bangladesh), Filipino, Unknown, Other

description.left: Indicate if the diagnosis is based on clinical or histological (histo-pathological) criteria

diagnosis_ICD_category.name: diagnosis_ICD_category
diagnosis_ICD_category.description: Disease category as defined in the WHO ICD-10

meta.examples: Neoplasms, Diseases of the nervous system
meta.notes: This refers to the body systems chapters of the WHO ICD-10, https://apps.who.int/classifications/apps/icd/ClassificationDownload/DLArea/Download.aspx

diagnosis_ICD_term.name: diagnosis_ICD_term
diagnosis_ICD_term.description: ICD-10 code and term used to define a condtion

meta.examples: C41.1: Malignant neoplasms of mandible, C16.9: Malignant neoplasm of stomach, unspecified
meta.notes: Write code and full term used in ICD-10 separated by a (:). For WHO ICD-10 codes, refer to https://apps.who.int/classifications/apps/icd/ClassificationDownload/DLArea/Download.aspx

diagnosis_mondo_term.name: diagnosis_mondo_term
diagnosis_mondo_term.description: Mondo code and term used to define a condtion

meta.examples: MONDO_0002131: jaw cancer, MONDO_0001056: gastric cancer
meta.notes: Write code and full term used in MONDO separated by a (:). For MONDO codes, refer to https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/mondo

diagnosis_ICD_code.name: diagnosis_ICD_code
diagnosis_ICD_code.description: ICD-10 code used to define a condtion

meta.notes: Write the exact ICD-10 code - refer to https://apps.who.int/classifications/apps/icd/ClassificationDownload/DLArea/Download.aspx

diagnosis_mondo_code.name: diagnosis_mondo_code
diagnosis_mondo_code.description: Mondo code used to define a condtion

meta.notes: Write the exact MONDO code. For MONDO codes, refer to https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/mondo

notes.left: For self-reported information provide date when started taking the Rx.
notes.right: For self-reported information provide date when stopped taking the Rx.

description.left: Unique identifier of the diagnosis event, assigned by the data provider.
description.right: Indicate the diagnosis event in the clinical timeline that this biospecimen acquisition was related to.

description.left: Code used for the phenotype in the Human Phenotype Ontology terminology
description.right: Human Phenotype Ontology terminology for observed phenotype

notes.left: Write the exact code used in the HPO, for instance: HP:0001161. Please refer to the Human Phenotype Ontology at https://hpo.jax.org/app/ for code identification.
notes.right: Refer to the Human Phenotype Ontology at https://hpo.jax.org/app/ for code identification.

phenotype_HPO_term.name: phenotype_HPO_term
phenotype_HPO_term.description: Term used for the phenotype in the Human Phenotype Ontology terminology

meta.notes: Refer to the Human Phenotype Ontology at https://hpo.jax.org/app/ for code identification.
